{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3136983,"name":"","username":"IHateTuningPID","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/i/df705f/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-01-31T15:38:07.682Z","cooked":"

We are trying to read the output from an openMV on the RIO. The buffer quickly fills up at a rate of 9600 bits per second even if we don’t send anything. Is there a fix for this or are we doing something wrong?
On the Rio we are initializing with

new SerialPort(9600, SerialPort.Port.kUSB)

And setting the timeout to 0.01

Then using the getBytesReceived() function we see that it fills up quickly.
